item.title: 找不到客户，印度可能取消绿色电力项目
item.description: 印度正在考虑取消相当于该国多达五分之一的可再生能源发电能力的绿色发电项目，因为他们很难找到国家电力公司来购买他们的电力。【原文：India is considering canceling green power projects equivalent to as much as a fifth of the country’s renewable capacity because they’re struggling to find state utilities to buy their electricity.】

item.title: 欧洲气候协议将在 COP30 峰会前摊牌
item.description: 欧洲气候转型的下一阶段岌岌可危，各国部长将在布鲁塞尔举行会议，就未来 15 年的减排目标达成协议。【原文：The next stage of Europe’s climate transition hangs in the balance, with ministers meeting in Brussels to hash out a deal on the emissions cuts they expect to deliver over the next 15 years.】

item.title: <strong>历经 10 年，耗资 10 万亿美元，《巴黎协定》取得了哪些成果？
item.description: 2015 年在 COP21 上签署的《巴黎协定》是一项巨大的交易。但是，10 年过去了，我们为经济去碳化投入了 10 万亿美元，它取得了什么成果呢？【原文：The Paris Agreement was a huge deal when it was signed in 2015 at COP21. But after 10 years and $10 trillion dollars invested into decarbonizing our economies, what has it accomplished?】

item.title: 澳大利亚将在世界上首次规定家庭免费用电
item.description: 澳大利亚将强制要求公用事业公司在一天中的部分时间向一些家庭提供免费电力，以吸收过剩的太阳能发电，降低电费，提高电网稳定性。【原文：Australia will mandate utilities to provide free power to some households during parts of the day in a bid to soak up excess solar generation, reduce power bills and improve grid stability.】

item.title: 台风卡尔玛袭击菲律宾中部，数千人流离失所
item.description: 台风 "卡尔梅吉 "以强风和暴雨袭击了菲律宾中部地区，促使政府疏散了 75,000 多人。【原文：Typhoon Kalmaegi lashed the central Philippines with strong winds and heavy rains, prompting the government to evacuate more than 75,000 people.】

item.title: 肉类包装商 JBS 将支付 110 万美元和解纽约州气候诉讼案
item.description: 全球最大的肉类加工企业 JBS SA 已同意支付 110 万美元，以了结纽约州对该公司在减少运营对环境的影响方面误导公众的指控。【原文：JBS SA, the world’s largest meatpacker, has agreed to pay $1.1 million to settle a lawsuit by the state of New York over allegations the company misled the public about reducing the impact of its operations on the environment.】

item.title: 煤炭巨头缩减规模，亚洲煤炭巨头追逐财富
item.description:
在矿业巨头放弃世界上最脏的化石燃料的同时，像 Geo Energy 这样的风险承担者却在加倍努力。【原文：

Risk takers like Geo Energy are doubling down while mining giants abandon the world’s dirtiest fossil fuel. 

】

item.title: 欧盟高官警告不要顺从特朗普的 ESG 意愿
item.description: 欧盟高级官员之一特雷莎-里贝拉（Teresa Ribera）警告说，屈服于美国对欧盟绿色规则施加的压力，将阻碍企业在过渡期间获得所需的数据。【原文：Teresa Ribera, one of the European Union’s top officials, warned that succumbing to US pressure on the bloc’s green rules would block companies from receiving the data they need during the transition.】

item.title: 牙买加飓风保险损失预计高达 42 亿美元
item.description: 据数据公司 Verisk Analytics Inc.称，飓风梅利莎给牙买加陆上财产造成的损失目前在 22 亿美元到 42 亿美元之间。【原文：The insured costs of Hurricane Melissa’s damages to onshore property in Jamaica now range between $2.2 billion and $4.2 billion, according to data firm Verisk Analytics Inc.】

item.title: 德国计划提升行业前景，欧盟碳排放飙升至 80 欧元以上
item.description: 周一，在德国宣布对能源密集型产业提供新的支持，预计将提高排放量之后，欧盟碳期货升破了80欧元的关键技术位。【原文：European Union carbon futures rose through a key technical level of €80 on Monday, after Germany announced new support for energy-intensive industries that is expected to lift emissions.】

item.title: 应对气候变化的混合融资正停在惊人的低水平上
item.description: 据一份最新报告称，旨在减少排放或适应气候变化的私人资本和公共资本相结合的项目停滞在一个危险的低水平上。【原文：Projects combining private and public capital to cut emissions or adapt to climate change have stalled at a dangerously low level, according to a fresh report.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加的永久冻土正在以惊人的速度融化
item.description: 北极变暖的速度是地球上其他地方的四倍，今天的时事通讯将带您到阿拉斯加一探究竟。在那里，研究人员正在争分夺秒地了解永冻土及其储存的 1.4 万亿吨碳的变化情况。气候的命运岌岌可危。【原文：The Arctic has warmed four times faster than anywhere else on the planet, and today’s newsletter takes you to Alaska for a firsthand view. There, researchers are racing to understand what’s happening to permafrost and the 1.4 trillion tons of carbon it stores. Nothing less than the fate of the climate hangs in the balance.】

item.title: 北极的主要碳汇在气候变暖的世界中越来越不稳定
item.description:
研究人员正在争分夺秒地追踪永久冻土从碳汇转变为排放源的速度，而地球的气候正处于平衡之中。【原文：

Researchers are racing to track how fast permafrost is transitioning from a carbon sink to a source of emissions, with the Earth’s climate in the balance.

】

item.title: 贝莱德基金经理称人工智能衰退不会终结清洁技术的崛起
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）旗下一只主动管理型可持续发展旗舰基金的投资组合经理表示，担心人工智能押注看起来过于泡沫化的投资者，不应该认为推动人工智能发展的清洁技术公司也会陷入同样的泡沫。【原文：Investors worried that artificial intelligence bets look too frothy shouldn’t assume the clean-tech companies powering AI would be trapped in the same bubble, according to a portfolio manager overseeing one of BlackRock Inc.’s flagship actively managed sustainability funds.】

item.title: 台风 "卡尔玛 "逼近海岸，越南洪灾死亡人数攀升
item.description: 越南在上周破纪录的暴雨中死亡人数已攀升至 37 人，另一场强风暴正向该国沿海地区袭来，一些旅游中心的洪水再次上涨。【原文：Vietnam’s death toll from last week’s record-breaking downpours has climbed to 37 as another powerful storm bears down on the country’s coast and floodwaters rise again in some tourism hubs.】

item.title: 特朗普抨击股市，绿色投资者享受巨额回报
item.description: 清洁技术股的大幅反弹让绿色经济领域的投资者希望，他们终于可以翻过多年来表现不佳的惩罚性一页。【原文：A dramatic rebound in clean-tech stocks has investors in the green economy hoping they can finally turn the page on years of punishing underperformance.】

item.title: 欧盟的胡克斯特拉说："特朗普的转向是气候问题的'分水岭'时刻
item.description:
欧洲最高气候外交官表示，美国退出 COP30  峰会是一个打击，但 并没有关闭取得进展的道路  

。【原文：

Europe’s top climate diplomat said the US skipping the COP30 summit is a blow but doesn’t close down paths to progress. 

】

item.title: 卫星图像显示牙买加梅利莎岛的破坏规模
item.description: 完整体验请访问卫星图像揭示牙买加梅利莎岛的破坏规模【原文：For the full experience visit: Satellite Images Reveal Scale of Melissa Destruction in Jamaica】

item.title: 美国官员将跳过联合国气候谈判 特朗普斥之为 "骗局
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）正试图影响全球能源政策，但美国高层代表仍未出席在巴西举行的联合国气候谈判。【原文：High-level US representatives are staying away from the UN climate negotiations in Brazil, even as President Donald Trump seeks to influence energy policy globally.】

item.title: 政府称牙买加灾难债券现已触发
item.description: 牙买加政府表示，由于飓风 "梅丽莎 "的影响，牙买加的灾难债券现已启动。【原文：Jamaica’s catastrophe bond has now triggered as a result of the fallout from Hurricane Melissa, the government said.】

item.title: 梅丽莎-牙买加造成的损失预计将使保险公司损失高达 30 亿美元
item.description: 据财产情报公司 Cotality 称，飓风梅利莎在牙买加造成的破坏预计将使保险公司损失 10 亿至 30 亿美元。【原文：The wreckage caused by Hurricane Melissa in Jamaica is expected to cost insurers $1 billion to $3 billion, according to property intelligence company Cotality.】

item.title: 飓风 "梅利莎 "逐渐减弱，加勒比海地区的破坏性损失不断增加
item.description: 飓风梅利莎在驶向北大西洋时减弱，预计它在加勒比海造成致命破坏后将在北大西洋解体。【原文：Hurricane Melissa weakened as it headed toward the North Atlantic, where it’s expected to disintegrate after its deadly tear through the Caribbean.】

item.title: 揭秘世界电力超级用户
item.description: 数据中心的用电问题一直备受关注。但是，还有一个部门是用电大户，却在很大程度上没有受到关注。【原文：Data centers have caught a lot of heat for their electricity use. But there’s another sector that’s an electricity superuser, yet has largely escaped scrutiny.】

item.title: 巴西贝伦尝试数十亿美元的转型
item.description:
这座城市旨在通过新建公园、博物馆和酒店来重塑自我，以举办 COP30 气候大会。但是，当聚光灯褪去后会发生什么呢？【原文：

The city aims to reinvent itself with new parks, museums and hotels to host the COP30 climate conference. But what happens when the spotlight fades?

】

item.title: 印度顶级太阳能出口商调整供应链以绕过美国关税
item.description: 印度顶级太阳能电池板制造商Waaree Energies Ltd.表示，该公司正在重新配置其供应链，试图绕过高昂的美国进口关税，继续向占其订单近60%的美国供货。【原文：India’s top solar panel maker Waaree Energies Ltd. said it’s reconfiguring its supply chain in an attempt to get around steep US import tariffs and keep supplying to a country that accounts for nearly 60% of its orders.】

item.title: 认识隐藏的用电巨人
item.description:
林德集团首席执行官桑吉夫-兰巴（Sanjiv Lamba）解释了他如何看待电力需求的变化以及低碳氢能能否成为大业务。【原文：

Sanjiv Lamba, CEO of Linde, explains how he sees electricity demand changing and whether low-carbon hydrogen can ever become big business.

】

item.title: 气候变暖，中日携手开展台风研究
item.description: 中国和日本的科研机构计划在台风观测和研究方面开展合作，因为气温升高有可能使强大的风暴更具破坏性。【原文：Scientific institutions in China and Japan plan to collaborate on typhoon observations and research, as warming temperatures threaten to make the powerful storms more destructive.】

item.title: 巴西报告亚马逊森林砍伐量下降，尽管火灾次数创历史新高
item.description: 距离主办 COP30 全球气候峰会还有不到两周的时间，巴西周四宣布，尽管雨林遭遇了创纪录的野火，但亚马逊的森林损失与上一年相比下降了 11.1%。【原文：With less than two weeks to go before it hosts the COP30 global climate summit, Brazil announced Thursday that forest loss in the Amazon fell by 11.1% compared with the previous year, despite the rainforest experiencing record wildfires.】

item.title: 马克龙和默茨将确认出席 COP30，但回复者仍寥寥无几
item.description: 尽管人们担心世界上一些最大的排放国将回避在巴西举行的气候大会，但欧洲领导人很可能会大举出席 COP30。【原文：European leaders are likely to show up in force at COP30 despite concerns that some of the world’s biggest emitters will shun the climate conference in Brazil.】

item.title: 人工智能需求激增，得克萨斯州为二叠纪天然气发电厂提供 11 亿美元贷款支持
item.description: 得克萨斯州正在以 11 亿美元的低息贷款支持一家以天然气为燃料的二叠纪盆地发电厂，这是该州在 2021 年大面积停电后旨在加强供应的计划下最大的此类项目。【原文：Texas is backing a proposed Permian Basin power plant fueled by natural gas with a $1.1 billion low-interest loan, the largest such project under a state program aimed to shore up supplies after widespread blackouts in 2021.】
